ygData.subject: Re: PoF pulling
ygData.msgSnippet: ... It s too bad sit ins are a bit overdone now. Does anyone else think random death touches are probably one of the cheeziest cop out design decisions ever
ygData.messageBody:
On Wed, Dec 15/99, Ryan Honeyman <honeyman@...> wrote:
> From: Ryan Honeyman <honeyman@...>
>
> > what is a DT? remember, no such thing as a stupid question =)
>
> This is a DT:
>
> Cazic Thule says 'SHADA!'
>
> LOADING, PLEASE WAIT...
>
> Death Touch, Instant Death, =)
>

It's too bad sit ins are a bit overdone now. Does anyone else think
random death touches are probably one of the cheeziest cop out design
decisions ever made? It reminds me of something a 12 year old playing DM
in D&D for the first time would come up with, not something you'd expect
from a professional game designer. That and relying on obvious
programming flaws like zone in delay and through wall and ceiling agro
for their difficulty are probably the things that annoy me most about
this game.

--
Artificial Intelligence stands no chance against Natural Stupidity.
